meanings.definition: A person or group that lies in wait to attack by surprise.
meanings.sent1: The ambushers hid behind the trees, waiting to surprise their enemies.
meanings.sent2: The ambushers caught the travelers off guard as they passed through the narrow path.
meanings.sent3: The ambushers played a prank by jumping out unexpectedly during the game.
meanings.sent4: The ambushers in the movie struck fear into the hearts of the audience with their sudden attack.
meanings.sent5: The ambushers' stealthy tactics made them a formidable force on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To lie in wait to attack by surprise.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers decided to ambushers the enemy troops under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: The bandits ambushers unsuspecting travelers along the deserted road.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to ambushers the toy mouse when its owner is not looking.
meanings.sent4: The spy carefully planned to ambushers the target during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The hunters would often ambushers their prey near the watering hole.
